intro: Henckelia multinervia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has palmate leaves with prominent veins, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists worldwide.
